title: Is it better off winning early or later in provisionals?
body: I have just turned lvl 30 and played ranked. Won 4 games out of 5 and i currently want to be in silver 3+. I have a pretty good mmr so i have a chance, if i win 2 or 3 more games and lose the last 4 or 3 straight will i be placed lower because of my mmr being dropped in those last games?

replies.body: i think its actually better to win every single game you play in. gl with that {{champion:48}}
yeah but sometimes i have games that doesn't do too well, so i'm preparing for the outcomes.

Its better to never lose, but if you do, lose your later games.

If you win your early games it means your later games are harder as it improves your MMR. So winning average games and losing harder games is ok.
If you lose your early games it means your later games will be easier, so losing average games and winning easy games doesn't mean you are good, means you can beat bad people.

Cool thanks, because i thought it wouldn't matter if you won or lost earlier than later, thinking that it wont effect the tier i'll be placed in.

If your account has never been ranked before, going 7-3 SHOULD get you around Silver 4-3. Granted it might not.

In my first ever promos I lost my first 3 games and ended up going 3-7, got Bronze 2.

Doesn't matter where you start if you keep positive, learn from mistakes and focus on yourself and not your "shitty feeder teams" you will climb eventually.
As long as i've got a good mmr. My friends did 7-3,8-2 and got silver  1 and maybe gold, so it depends on the mmr.
